content.intro: M7: Data In Sustainable Energy | Chapter 4

content.text: The energy sector is undergoing significant transformation driven by the integration of new renewable energy sources, increasing electrification, and a growing need for energy efficiency . This transformation introduces complexities like intermittency of power sources and needs for storage and flexibility, necessitating advanced data management and strategic planning. In addition, a rise in the digitalization of the energy system yields vast amounts of data and, consequently, a greater need for data governance. Simultaneously, advancements in artificial intelligence (A.I.) and data science are opening new avenues for innovation. Machine learning models have enabled tasks like image recognition, chatbots, and automated data analysis. In the energy sector, A.I. is used in many applications. It enhances demand and supply predictions, optimizes energy efficiency, manages renewable energy sources, controls smart grids, and conducts predictive maintenance where energy asset performance is continuously analyzed and monitored. This chapter provides an overview of the most prominent applications of A.I. in the energy sector.
